column3: Which age group do you belong to?
column4: How long have you worked with your current team?
column6: Which of the following describes your area of work the best?
column7: What role do you take in the Scrum team?
column8: Does your job involve leadership responsibilities within your team?
column9: Which statement about your team’s application of Scrum do you feel fit your team the best?
column10: My team shares a common understanding of why we use Scrum
column11: My team shares a common understanding of why we adopted Scrum
column12: Does your company use Stand Up Meetings (frequent short meetings, intended to improve collaboration and cooperation)?
column13: I feel personally motivated in my work by doing Daily Stand Ups
column14: The daily stand up supports and empowers my team’s work process
column15: I don’t understand why my company has chosen to do daily stand ups
column16: Does your team use Sprints (a time-boxed collection of work during which a potentially releasable product Increment is created)?
column17: The Sprint structure allows us to deliver our work frequently (to a client, customer, a co-worker etc.)
column18: The sprint structure motivates me in my work
column19: The Sprint structure supports and empowers my team’s work process
column20: I understand why my company has chosen to use Sprints
column21: Does your company use Sprint Planning (a meeting wherein your team plans the work you will do in the upcoming sprint)?
column22: In our Sprint planning, my team produces our own Sprint Plan, that we take ownership over
column23: In our Sprint planning, my team organizes our work in the way we think is best
column24: Does your company use Sprint Reviews (a meeting at the end of the sprint, wherein your team reviews the work you did during the sprint)?
column25: Sprint reviews help me reflect on the work we do
column26: I don’t understand why my company has chosen to use Sprint Reviews
column27: Does your company use Sprint Retrospectives (a meeting at the end of a Sprint wherein your team reviews the processes and tools used to conduct the Sprint)?
column28: Sprint retrospectives help me reflect on the way we work
column29: I don’t understand why my company has chosen to use Sprint Retrospectives
column30: Using Scrum has made me more open and honest with my teammates/co-workers
column31: I actively put in effort to support our Scrum practices
column32: Using Scrum has made made it easier to react constructively to changes in our work
column33: Using Scrum has increased my feelings of ownership and responsibility over the work we do
column34: Using Scrum has helped my understanding the business needs of my company
column35: Our implementation of Scrum creates an un-sustainable work process that wears me out
column36: Our primary measure of progress is the work we complete in our Sprints
column37: Our implementation of Scrum has given me more confidence in suggesting changes to our work processes
column38: Our implementation of Scrum has made me less open to try new things

column8: Yes, for parts of the team
column9: We work loosely based on the Scrum Guide, picking and choosing the parts that fit us
We follow the Scrum Guide to the dot
We are inspired by Scrum, but have created our own version with major changes
We follow the Scrum Guide to the dot
